00029 #include <sys/types.h>
00030 #include <sys/xattr.h>
00031 #include <stdio.h>
00032 #include <stdlib.h>
00033 #include <string.h>
00034 #include <errno.h>
00035 
00036 void usage(char *prog)
00037 {
00038         printf("Usage: %s <pathname>\n", prog);
00039 }
00040 
00041 /* Test the listxattr return value when the buffer is small. */
00042 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00043 {
00044         char *path, *buf;
00045         ssize_t ret_buf, ret_null, error_s;
00046         int ret = 0;
00047 
00048         if (argc != 2) {
00049                 usage(argv[0]);
00050                 exit(1);
00051         }
00052 
00053         path = argv[1];
00054 
00055         ret_null = listxattr(path, NULL, 0);
00056         if (ret_null < 0) {
00057                 fprintf(stderr, "listxattr(%s, NULL, 0) failed "
00058                                 "with %i: %s\n", path, errno,
00059                                  strerror(errno));
00060                 ret = errno;
00061                 goto out;
00062         }
00063 
00064         /* LU-3403 llite: error of listxattr when buffer is small */
00065         if (ret_null < 2) {
00066                 fprintf(stderr, "listxattr(%s, NULL, 0) returned"
00067                                         "a sizes less than 2", path);
00068                 ret = EINVAL;
00069                 goto out;
00070         }
00071 
00072         error_s = ret_null - 1;
00073         buf = (char *)malloc(error_s);
00074         if (buf == NULL) {
00075                 fprintf(stderr, "malloc(%zi) failed with %i: %s\n",
00076                                 error_s, errno, strerror(errno));
00077                 ret = errno;
00078                 goto out;
00079         }
00080 
00081         ret_buf = llistxattr(path, buf, error_s);
00082         if (ret_buf != -1) {
00083                 fprintf(stderr, "llistxattr(%s, %p, %zi) passed with %zi but "
00084                                 "should have failed with -1\n", path, buf,
00085                                  error_s, ret_buf);
00086                 ret = EINVAL;
00087                 goto free;
00088         }
00089 
00090 free:
00091         free(buf);
00092 out:
00093         return ret;
00094 }
